description: This is a conversation of my website to answer questions.

output.text:
A.I. describes autonomous programs that are capable of goal directed behavior, and Cognitive computing describes technology platforms that, broadly speaking, are based on the scientific disciplines of Artificial Intelligence and Signal Processing. These platforms encompass machine learning, reasoning, natural language processing, speech and vision, human-computer interaction, dialog and narrative generation and more.

Cognitive Computing is a term that IBM has brought into prevalence. In various forums IBM’s definition of Cognitive Computing has varied from "intersection of NLP and AI" to more visionary forms like a "machine that can interact and think like humans". Most other players in the industry have made their own assumptions in this range, and have gone about implementing this vision in completely different ways. 

Artificial Intelligence is more well understood concept, esp. in academia. It generally refers to machines that can train themselves to solve certain class of problems.

Artificial intelligence (AI) is intelligence exhibited by machines. In computer science, an ideal "intelligent" machine is a flexible rational agent that perceives its environment and takes actions that maximize its chance of success at some goal.
